sense.def: Alternative Writing xuan yun 旋運 ; yun xuan 運眩 ; tou xuan 頭眩 , the head is dizzy.

① Illness Sign of a perception of the body and its surroundings as revolving, together with darkness developing in front of the eyes. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 17: 治風頭旋，眼目昏痛， 眩運，倦怠，心忪，芎藭散方 , “To cure head wind spinning; visual clouding with pain and dizziness with movement , exhaustion and heart agitation, [use] the recipe for the powder with xiong qiong ”. LSZ: 眩是目黑，運是頭旋 , “ 眩 stands for darkness in front of the eyes; 運 stands for a revolving movement perceived in the head”.
② Pathological Condition with vertigo as its main pathological sign. Xuan ming lun fang 宣明論方 3: 眩運嘔吐，謂風熱 之甚也 , “ Vertigo with vomiting, that is to say: excessive wind heat”.
